meanings.definition: The act of closing or shutting down a business or operation.
meanings.sent1: The closedown of the factory left many workers without jobs.
meanings.sent2: The closedown of the store was unexpected and caused confusion.
meanings.sent3: The closedown of the ice cream shop made the kids sad.
meanings.sent4: The closedown of the theater was like the final curtain falling on a play.
meanings.sent5: The closedown of the restaurant was sudden and surprising.

meanings.definition: The process of ceasing operations or activities.
meanings.sent1: After the closedown of the event, everyone started cleaning up.
meanings.sent2: The closedown of the school for summer break was eagerly awaited.
meanings.sent3: The closedown of the party happened earlier than expected.
meanings.sent4: The closedown of the computer system caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent5: The closedown of the park signaled the end of the day.

meanings.definition: To close or shut down a business or operation.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to closedown its branches in other cities.
meanings.sent2: They had to closedown the factory due to financial difficulties.
meanings.sent3: The decision to closedown the shop was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent4: The storm forced them to closedown the outdoor event for safety.
meanings.sent5: She had to closedown her online store temporarily for maintenance.
